snippet.title: Technically Incorrect
snippet.description: Chris Matyszczyk brings a fresh and irreverent perspective to the tech world.

snippet.title: The importance of the earnest selfie: Rihanna has an 'Instassistant'
snippet.description: Stars are realizing that their selfies have to be just so. Some are therefore delegating selfie-taking to trusted photographers.

snippet.title: Mozilla names insider Chris Beard as interim CEO
snippet.description: Trying to recover quickly from a firestorm over gay marriage that brought down its last CEO in just 11 days, Mozilla names a new chief executive and begins to reshape its board.

snippet.title: Spotify's 2012 dominated by Gotye, Rihanna
snippet.description: The company today revealed that Gotye's "Somebody That I Used to Know" was its most popular track in the U.S. this year.

snippet.title: Doc Brown appears in his Delorean at CES 2014
snippet.description: In a celebrity appearance courtesy of Gibson, Christopher Lloyd drove up in his Delorean from Back To The Future. Our editors go hands on with the time machine...

snippet.title: David Brown Automotive Speedback GT: Vintage look, modern foundation
snippet.description: David Brown loves classic cars -- the look, style and speed appeals. The reliability does not. So he's decided to make a car that looks like it was penned in the '60s, but has modern mechanicals. Essentially, the Speedback, DBA's debut car, is the best of both worlds. We spoke to Brown about his car.

snippet.title: Doc Brown finally admits Funny or Die hoverboard video is fake
snippet.description: In an apology titled, "Funny Or Die is Sorry for Lying about Hoverboards," actor Christopher Lloyd owns up to the ruse that went on a day too long.

snippet.title: Snapchat lawyers seek to silence Reggie Brown
snippet.description: In the suit against Snapchat, lawyers fear an oversharing Brown will expose unflattering secrets about the company.

snippet.title: Sony's official PS4 unboxing is brown-gloved, bonkers
snippet.description: This bizarre new video from Sony has a brown-gloved stranger opening up the PS4, in a bunker, with a menacing score.

snippet.title: The 404 at CES 2014: Where we steamed up with Peter Brown (podcast)
snippet.description: This year's CES brought more gaming news than usual, so we recruit Peter Brown from GameSpot to chat about Razer's Project Christine, Sony PlayStation Now, the latest Oculus Rift, and Valve's Steam Machine lineup.
